department: Art of Africa and the Americas
description: rectangular board with protruding carved arrow at top; text from Qur'an written in ink on either side of board, surrounded by delicate border; one side has decorations of square spirals across C; the other side has geometric zigzag pattern
text: In Islamic Africa, the Qur’anic board is primarily used to teach Arabic grammar, verses of the Qur’an, and the art of calligraphy. But some boards are also used by Islamic healers, who write specific verses on them, then wash off the verses, taking care to collect the diluted ink. The liquid is given to the sick to drink as holy medicine.
title: Qur'anic board
